title.narrative: PME:DEVELOPMENT EFFECTIVENESS AND CROSS SECT

description.narrative: By the end of 2019, policymakers and other actors involved in planning, M&E and coordination in favor of child rights have the required skills, strategic tools and access to up-to-date evidence (disaggregated data and analysis), which contributes to Building Capacity For Evaluation, Cross-Sectoral Monitoring, Data And Situation Analyses, Cross-Sectoral Planning And Programme Reviews, Disaster Risk Reduction, Evaluation And Research. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Evaluations, Research And Data, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, United Nations Working Together. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: [Programme Effectiveness] : Country programmes are efficiently designed, coordinated, managed and supported to meet quality programming standards in achieving results for children.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By the end of 2019, policymakers and other actors involved in planning, M&E and coordination in favor of child rights have therequired skills, strategic tools and access to up-to-date evidence (disaggregated data and analysis)

description.narrative: With UNICEF support, the Government made further steps towards monitoring child rights, with the successful transition of the national information system DevInfo and the harmonization of the regional statistical yearbooks' methodology. UNICEF achieved almost all the planned indicators for 2019. One of the main achievements was the finalization of the Programme of Cooperation Mali-UNICEF 2020-2024. An innovative Country Programme Document based on five programmatic shifts was developed building on a participatory approach informed by the Situation Analysis and large-scale evaluations. Field monitoring through third-party monitoring using dedicated technologies was designed and piloted, ready for scale-up in 2020. | Status:Met | As-of Date:07/02/2020
